div.l: And þ̉erfore yefe ye vouchesaufe to here
Butte god Forbede þat we Stynte here
A tale of me þat Am A poure Man
I woll you telle as well As eủer I can
A litulle Iape þat Fylle in ower Cytte
Ower hoste answerede And sayde I gᵃraunte to the
Now telle on Roger loke þat hitt be gode
For manye A paste haste þou letten blode
And manye A Iacke of Dover haste þou Solde
That beene twyse hote And twyse colde
Of manye A pilgryme haste þou Cristes curse
For of thy parcelye yett þey Fare the worse
That þey haue etene with the Stubbill goose
For in thy Schopp̄e is Manye A Flye loose
Now telle on gentulle Roger by thy name
Butte yett I praye the be notte wroþe For game
A Man maye saye soþe boþe in game ⁊and playe
Thou sayeste Fulle Soþe quod Roger by my Faye
Butte Soþe playe qwade playe As þe Flem̄mmenge sayeþe
And þ̉erfore harri Bayliffe by thy Faythe
Be þou notte wrothe or we departen here
Thoughe þat my tale be of An hostelere
Butte neủerþeles I nylle notte tellen itt yett
Butte Ar we parte ywysse þou schalte be qwytte
And þ̉erwithall he loughe And made chere
And sayde his tale As ye schall affter here
Here endith the prolog And

begynnythe
the tale of the Coke
A prentyse whylome dwelte in ower Cytte
And of a crafte of vitayllers was he
Gaylarde he was As goldfynche in the Schawe
Broune as berye A propre Schorte Fellawe
With lockes blacke y kempte Fulle Festislye
